caption: Dinner before a comedy show. My first night out since quarantine. Great food, had the Rigatoni with eggplant, rich tomato sauce, manicotti was also a big hit at our table. Then on to the evening entertainment. Funny comics, tables were spaced well. Really enjoyed myself, and plan on going back soon.
Tastes like home. I haven't had a delicious meal like this since I left home for college.
A favorite location for quality Italian food. Service is always timely even when they have a full house. I look forward to a return trip. This place has an awesome atmosphere.
Ordered cake tonight from positanos. When I opened the take out container there was mold.  I will not be returning for more moldy cake.
Good, simple Italian,  done right and ar the right price. We'll be back for local stand up comedy on Saturday nights.

We are from Pennsylvania and Positano was recommended to us if we found ourselves in Bethesda for dinner. The flavors of our dishes were fresh and well balanced. The service was excellent and the prices VERY reasonable. If we find ourselves in Bethesda at dinnertime again, Positano will be our destination.
Covid safe patio dining. Our server, Luca, was phenomenal. He took care of our party of 10 with incredible attention to all of our needs and the food was delicious.

We were at Positano’s in early March for a birthday dinner. We had a great experience in one of the few genuine Italian restaurants in the DMV area. Not mentioning the delicious Italian recipes that the chef put forth, we also were met with the owner’s personal touch who greeted us at the door and was present throughout the night making sure our every need was met. The ambiance was cozy and intimate with amazing live music was being played in the background. Definitely a night worth remembering!

Positano Ristorante is simply the best authentic Italian place in the area! The food is to die for and you cannot go wrong with any of the options on the menu. It is also a really good location for a family function or business event with its unique ambience.The staff are very friendly and the manager ,Mr.Jimmy is always around with his warm hospitality.Overall Positano should be a must if you are around the metropolitan area!!

Best Italian food in the DMV!  Wonderful experience and friendly staff.  Still better than ever and taking great precautions to keep customers safe and healthy during these times.  If I could give more than 5 stars I would!

We just had a mini rehearsal wedding dinner at Positano on Saturday night.  The food was fabulous.  We sat socially distanced inside and felt very safe.  They also have terrific outside seating.  Service was great and they made us feel special.  Best Italian Restaurant I've been to in the area.  We're certainly going back.
Ordered a vegetarian dish, came with chicken in it, and didn’t offer to refund, and my bf ordered a dish with eggplant, no eggplant, definitely won’t go back again

Use some caution. I noted 90% of the reviewers have only a single review or if you bother to look they do reviews all over the US giving each place a 5* review. Leading me to believe these are paid for reviews. This restaurant is tried and in some sunset period of it's life.
One of the best place to have authentic Italian food.  Nice environment and delicious food! Also very good place for party and weddings! Best service! Highly recommend!! ❤️

This is some of the best Italian food I’ve ever had. Whenever I’m in downtown Bethesda, I make it my first priority to stop by for a warm and comforting meal. I HIGHLY recommend the Chicken Milanese with fried calamari as a go-to appetizer. I’ve taken family, friends, and co-workers and all have only thanked me for introducing them to this place. The owners are so welcoming and waitstaff are so helpful and kind that it’s the kind of place that makes you feel right at home.
Great owner and staff
Great service, food was really tasty and on time. The staff was friendly and polite.

Unlike other restaurants in the area, Positano without a doubt has a real authentic feel to it.  The portions are traditionally on the smaller size (like many places you'll find in Europe), but the quality is some of the best around Bethesda and DC.  Every time I've been here,  i've left the place full and satisfied (and i've been here quite a few times as well).  The interior design, decorations, and layout really add to the authenticity too (as if you're dining on the streets in Italy), and you really get a sense of the history behind it.  It's one of the oldest restaurants in the city, but despite that still holds it's own compared to any of the countless restaurants that have popped up and disappeared through the years here.     When things start getting back to normal, i would highly recommend anyone to stop by and try!

Whenever I crave Italian there's not much more I can ask for than the mouth watering selections at Positano Ristorante. You can taste and see and smell the unique influence of home and culture at this gem of a family owned restaurant in downtown Bethesda. The intimate setting, friendly staff and family love that shapes the mood of the restaurant only enhances the dining experience. I love love their veal for a main and their white pizza and bruschetta as appetizers. If you're looking for an authentic Italian gourmet experience in MD - you've definitely found your spot. I look forward to my next trip x

So I went to Positano this past holiday season for my cousin’s birthday and I was blown away. I had the manicotti with chicken Milanese and the cheesy pasta practically melted in my mouth, and the breaded chicken was prepared just right, and wasn’t burnt at all. Service was also very welcoming too. The atmosphere reminded me of a family owned restaurant back in Italy when I visited last year, I’ll definitely be going back once I’m back in town!

Highly recommend Positano! The place is top notch and the place makes you feel like your at a authentic Italian ristorante. The food never disappoints no matter what I’ve ordered thus far! So that’s an A plus and the service here is very friendly. This will always be my go to for as long as I’m here. Thanks Positano!
Amazing service. Fantastic ambiance with excellent food at affordable prices - couldn't ask for more. If you're ever in the area, Positanos is a must-have.

I came here with my boyfriend for our date night. It was a dreamy experience. I ordered the lasagna. It was the best lasagna I’ve ever had in this area. To top it off there was a musician there that sat next to us and sang and played his guitar for us. Loved everything about this place!
The scenery inside and outside is amazing, customer service is top tier and the food is on another level, overall everything is amazing. Ive gone a couple times and never a bad experience.

Went to this place for the first time, and hands down,  definitely one of the best Italian restaurants in the area. Open for dine-in and takeout during these hard times. It’s not just the delicious food that will make you go back every time but the hospitality and customer service from the staff and the vintage vibe of the restaurant itself, which fits perfectly with it being Italian restaurant. The food is just amazingly delicious for words. Looking for a place to eat with friends or family?  I highly recommend Positano Ristorante.
Went to Positanos for the first time a few weeks ago and fell in love. The staff is incredibly charming and insightful and the food was to die for. The gnocchi is my favorite!

Incredible venue owned by a wonderful, classy, and genuine Italian family. Wine selection is excellent, and only matched by the great food. Outside seating is to die for, and I have particularly enjoyed ordering to go during this pandemic.... with absolutely no notice of degradation of their food quality. Please order from these folks during this crazy time! Best Italian cuisine you'll have in your life, and once COVID is no more, this will be the first place I go back to when I visit the DC area again!  It isn't authentic Italian if they don't treat you like family... this place doesn't treat me like family, they made me a part of their family. Can't wait to get back!  Cheers!
Amazing Italian food, very welcoming staff, Overall excellent experience, will be there again!!!

Lovely place. The patio is very unique and great for these covid times. The food is authentic and the service i couldn't relate. They were on point with everything. Highly recommend them for any afternoon drink or a date with your significant other. Classy establishment with modern, quick, service. Buon Appetito!

Positano has a great authentic family atmosphere with amazing food :) if you are looking for somewhere new for date night or a family dinner this place is the place for you. Although I’ve never been to Italy this place makes you feel like you’re there with the food, the ambiance and the interior is amazing. Would recommend to anyone!

Great place to go to if you’re looking for quality Italian food in Montgomery County. I came here as part of a private event where we brought a projector to screen a short film we had created. The servers were helpful and accommodating, the food was great, and as a bonus, the ambiance makes for a cozy meal.

The food was fresh, properly prepared and a great value for the price. The best Italian food in the DMV area by far. I ordered the soup of the day and it cleared my headache, as well as the garlic bread, it was made so fresh and definitely one of my favorite items on the menu. I’m looking forward to my next visit, I’ll definitely have to come back and i highly recommend if anyone’s looking for authentic Italian food, Positano Ristorante is the spot.

An amazing experience from begging to end . The staff is super courteous and the food is magnificent. Im glad I ventured from my regular go to restaurants, and had the pleasure to experience Positano Ristorante. I recommend the Salmon , always cooked to perfection.

My family and I have been enjoying dinner at Positano for over 10 years. The interior is beautiful. If given the opportunity, patio seating is delightful as well.  On your first visit, the bruschetta appetizer and the lasagna are a must try. Their marinara sauce is a delicate balance between sweet, salt and tart, perfectly complementing any dish. I always save a little bit of bread for the end of the meal, just to soak up that last burst of flavor the sauce has to offer.
Went here for a friend’s birthday and the service was top notch and the food quality was amazing. Many different choices to choose from, very beautiful setting and had a great time, 100% recommend
The experience was amazing really great service could have ask for anything else 10/10 amazing time.

I had a great time. The atmosphere is very inviting and the food was great. One of the best Tortellini's I've ever had. Our waiter was also very nice. I will be coming back again soon. I definitely recommend dining here if you are in an Italian mood!

I've eaten at Positano over the years and I must say it is the best authentic Italian cuisine in this area.  When you first enter the restaurant, it has a very soothing ambience and the aesthetic is very fitting of the name.  The space is well decorated,  with beautiful imagery and a classic Italian theme.  There is a vast amount of tasty food choices on the menu, with my personal favorite being the Chicken Parmesan!  I have also tried different pastas and seafood as well, and I must say you can really taste the quality of the ingredients.  The service is outstanding and has been for many years, and I will continue to make this my #1 place to eat when I'm in downtown Bethesda.

The best Italian in my area. I recently took my family out for dinner here. We had a good time and excellent service from the staff. It was family-owned and everyone was polite in there. And it had authentic Italian scenery both inside and outside. You could tell everything was made in house, from the bread to the sauce. The special fish of the day always hits the spot! Will be back soon!

Wonderful service with exceptional meal. I got a chance to celebrate a friends birthday during this pandemic. Social distancing was in place, the waiter was very polite as well. I appreciate the service and look forward to my next visit.
Positano is such a fantastic restaurant!!! Love the environment and the staff. They all were super friendly/helpful and the food is AMAZING. Definitely would recommend to anyone who hasn’t been:)

I had my birthday dinner at this restaurant and it was an excellent eating experience.. from walking in the door and being greeted by employees, seated and drink order taken, was maybe 5 minutes. Meal was served hot and excellent taste. Server was very friendly and helpful. The restaurant set up, lighting, and location is also great for date night as well.

It's easy to forget you're in Bethesda, Maryland when you dine at a place like Positano. It masterfully imitates the style, feel, and, most importantly, taste of an authentic Italian restaurant (I know because I've toured Italy from Lake Como to the city of Matera). As a Bethesdian for over 40 years and an avid worldly traveler, it's nice to know, especially now when we're all stuck at home, that my family and I don't have to travel far for a taste of Italy.  I am generally not the type of person to write reviews, but my most recent experience at Postiano last Saturday surely warrants one. Let me preface the following by saying that I've been here before and to nearly every other restaurant in Bethesda countless times over. Bethesda's restaurants tend to suffer from a lack of consistency, with the recently closed Cafe Deluxe being a textbook example. The inconsistency in Bethesda was evident long before Corona ever came into the picture. This resulted in what I call "temporary favorites." Restaurants, such as Olazzo, Mon Ami Gabi, Persimmon, and Foong Lin, among a small handful, had their good days and months but eventually they all suffered from some creeping form of deterioration, either in the food, service, or both.  Some of the issues I previously experienced with these restaurants either resurfaced or were exacerbated by Corona. Most notably, the portion sizes have shrunk and service has slowed greatly.  I can probably understand the latter but there is no excuse for the former.  Positano isn’t a “temporary favorite.” It has been one of my three safety-net favorites during the past decade (with the other two being in Virginia). I never have to worry if what I ordered will be as good as the last time, about the kids not liking their food, or if the service will be bad. Simply put, this restaurant has been consistently good and my most recent experience has reinforced my opinion. What was so unique about my most recent experience? Nothing! The food was excellent and the service was professional – this being consistent is what I value most.  My wife loves the Eggplant Parmigiana and my kids always order the Chicken Parmigiana with a side of spaghetti. I would recommend the Veal Milanese because it’s both tender and crispy, and closely resembles what I had in Milan.  If you’re looking for a surefire place to eat at (or even an escape from our current situation), go here.
The ambiance in this most authentic restaurant is elegant. The food is unparalleled to other Italian cuisine in the area. If you want a true taste of Italy, Positano will give you that and more.

Hands down the best Italian restaurant I have been to in the DMV area. Family-owned since the beginning. Highly recommend the cannelloni and fresh fish filet of the day. Amazing atmosphere and service.

Positano is a beautiful establishment located at the heart of old Bethesda. The food and hospitality is amazing followed by delicious food that makes you want to come back. A great place for your next meal.

I love coming here. Everytime I've come I've been welcome with warm greetings and a smile. I have never left here unsatisfied either and I've come here fairly often in the past. I love the lasagna, pasta is always made fresh and the cakes are to die for. I would recommend them to anyone looking for a family style meal look no further.

Maybe the worst experience I have ever had. Our delivery came in these mini greasy portions. I called to ask about it and the rudest man hung up on me without so much as hearing my question. Clearly do not care about customer service. I would avoid at all cost. Also they said they do not cook with oil... you can see the volume of grease in my tiny portion.

One of the best italian restaurants in the DMV, for great value too. Enjoyed more than a few family dinners eating here, with the staff making it feel like home and the food being consistently amazing - always look forward to going again. Had veal there and I think about it every day

I have been a faithful customer of   Positano Ristorante for about a year. I am very selective concerning where I contribute my money, because it can be hard to find consistent quality , but this place has exceeded my standards. First, the customer service is amazing. I am always greeted whether I dine in or carry out. The staff is personable, and they even know me by name/the usual order for me (Chicken Milanese+Bruschetta which is amazingggg). Jimmy, who is the owner, has greeted my table various times during my dining which adds a personal touch. It is always clean and comfortable, while maintaining a “fine-dining” ambiance. Service is prompt, professional, and informed. The food is always fresh and hot, despite the 30 minute drive home. The prices are very  reasonable. I am a firm believer in supporting small businesses especially, as they often offer a greater deal of all around quality than many popular food chains, and hidden gems I must say. As of late, they have been closed given current circumstances. But when they open up? I will be the first order lol. Thank you Jimmy and the team for this wonderful establishment. 10 stars across the board 👍🏻

Positano’s is amazing top to bottom. Truly a beautiful family owned restaurant that serves the best Italian food around. The service exceeds my expectations and their staff really helps make your meals a lovely experience. One of my favorite restaurants for sure, 12/10 recommend.

This is my favorite restaurant in the east coast. The food has depths of flavor and is uniquely italian. The service is professional but not cold like most other restaurants. You can see that everyone gets along and is eager to meet visitors. They even invited us to  join them on their picnics or play soccer. And you have to try the Bruschetta and Chicken Milanese.

Stopped in for a birthday dinner. Employees greeted us with warm welcomes and were very friendly. Food was very good and reasonably priced. Overall, great service and delicious food, I highly recommend a visit.
Delicious food with an authentic Italian ambiance that is unmatched in the DMV area. It's perfect for both small and large gatherings, and the service is quality. Highly recommend!

Positano has quickly become my favorite Italian restaurant in the area. I dined in with a friend for dinner yesterday and we were both impressed with how clean the restaurant was. The homey authentic Italian ambiance and cleanliness made me feel safe and relaxed. On top of that, the service was excellent! We started with the calamari which was superb and I ordered the Veal Scallopini for the main. This is my favorite Italian dish and Positano made it to perfection. Lastly, for dessert we ordered a tiramisu and cappuccinos.. the perfect way to end the meal! I definitely recommend trying this place out if you like great Italian food and an authentic experience.
Amazing food. Excellent ingredients. Never walked out disappointed. I come here with my family and friends on weekends. Dey got a lot of main courses as well as side dishes.

If you want an authentic Italian meal, Positano is where you go. Great value. Beautiful atmosphere. Lovely service. Food cooked to perfection, made me fall deeper in love with Italian cuisine. This restaurant is a must.

Had a lunch here with a friend of mine and overall great dining experience here !!! Don’t know where to start the hospitality, desert, or the PASTA lol. Great customer service and very authentic Italian dishes. Had the real Italiano experience at Positano ! Family and kids friendly. Definitely will be coming back with the family.
The food at Positano is always fresh and tasteful and the service is even better. This place is always my go to for when I’m craving some Italian food. Best Italian spot in the DMV!

Positano is one of the most beautiful restaurants I’ve visited. It’s such great service, everyone is polite and respectful there. And they’re quick with their service. The food is to die for. It is so tasteful and amazing quality. I would recommend it 100%. If anyone visits Bethesda , this is the place to go to. And a plus, the environment is beautiful great architecture you really feel you’re in italy

I had a wonderful experience at Positano and was very impressed with both the service and food quality. The ambience was exceptional and I would highly recommend a meal at this authentic Italian restaurant where the hospitality is second to none.
This is probably the best Italian-American place in Maryland. So good.
I chose this place because they have a lot of gluten free options which was great. It was my birthday so they offered me a dessert.
Saw a great folk show there last night! Great food and a beautiful building

Horrible service.  Horrible waiter.  Were in a large party with two tables.  Served bread and ordered drinks and meals to one table.  Had to ask management to ask the waiter to serve the the other table.  Manager was very confrontational when asked how come one of the two tables were served on.  Experience ruined ruined my entire evening.  As a response to the owner....your horrible service and dismissive staff made me "angry".  My day was going quite fine until entering your establishment.  The other members of my party also said your service was horrible.  Your waiter lost a credit card of one of my party members.  I would not recommend anyone to attend your establishment.

Maybe 2.5 stars. Came here for a group event. Mediocre food (grilled salmon, chicken marsala and spaghetti with meatballs) was served family style but there was not enough for each person at the table. It took 30 min for people to get additional food despite getting none to begin with. The second serving of spaghetti with meatballs came as only pasta without the meatballs. Trying to cut corners. Wine was cheap/bad. I complained to the event organizer never to use this place again.

Called to work out an issue with an Uber Eats order. The restaurant employee that answered the phone claimed to not work with Uber Eats, and hung up on me. This is not how you deal with potential customers. Will never eat here and will recommend to our friends and neighbors to not utilize this business.
Always great food and service here.
Authenticity
My white vongole was way underseasoned and tasteless. 3 Stars is being generous.
Best Italian in bethesda
The food was delicious especially the salmon and ziti pasta. However, it was FREEZING in the restaurant. The staff were friendly and accommodating.

Gordon R. would have a field day. Bread crumbs pressed in the menus, dust everywhere, older male server hanging out watching football. Hoping the kitchen was cleaner and better organized than front-of-house. Female server was nice and food alright, but won’t be going back.

We went here on Christmas eve because it was one of the few places that was serving their full menu.  Positano is supposedly a long-loved and well known establishment that in the nearly 20 years I've lived here never went to.  We finally decided to go while family was in town for xmas eve.  Sorry we did.  Our waiter complained about how over worked he was, ignored us and never came around after we seated (helping two other tables that were seated after us before getting around taking our drink orders).  We had to ask for the pre-meal bread twice, beers were forgotten from our initial order.  Twice he ridiculed my father for being a nondrinker even after we told him twice my father HAD to quit drinking.  My food came out cold and was 1/2 the portion size of the others who ordered the  exact same dish.  I could keep going on and on about how bad this was but what's the point; I'm sure you get the idea.  We arrived having promised the kids they could order dessert and left without dessert and had to ask for the bill twice.  I clearly stated I wanted the bill but when he arrived with it he kept holding up to the entire table asking who wanted it...staring at my parents (whom he doted on all night, btw).  Despite me (a woman - the problem maybe?) raising my hand to have him give it to me he placed it in the middle of the table somewhat close to my parents.  He was horrible.  WE will never go back.

Went here twice in one weekend- once with work and once with family. We've been here a few times over the past years but this time was really great. We were in the private party room both times this year and the service was excellent and of course the food was amazing.

We went here for a bat mitzvah. It was nicely set up where the kids where in the front with the dj booth and music while the adults had tables in the back. We did journey forward to get our drinks at the open bar but besides that had our own space. Food was alright, plain and simple and served.

Food was reliably leaving you craving to return. Environment is cozy and with all the Italian touches one looks for in an Italian restaurant. There appears to only be one waiter doubling as the host, and thus, long periods of time may go by without being greeted or served as the waiter is in the kitchen.
Fantastic Italian restaurant. It reminds us our trip to Italy and we also were in Positano (south). Great food and nice Italian ambiance.The staff is very nice and the prices are reasonable.
Okay place to eat but not the best Italian.   The ambiance was everything though.  I would go back.
Amazing food. Great taste. This food is authentic. I come here on special events and casual dates. I love the atmosphere, but the food is the reason to come. The host is attentive and amicable.
Poor service. Limited sense of hospitality or guest service. 5/10 people fell sick after the dinner here.
Saw comedy show...great food...good fun cheap laughs.
Old school Italian at its best. So many hidden rooms; if you ever need a special event place or just want to have dinner with 50 of your closest friends this is a great place.

Pros: food was decent  Cons: Took my father here to celebrate a special night. When we left his comment was, "Wow.  I've had bad service before but I've never felt like a place intentionally neglected my table before."  I intended to celebrate my dad and left feeling bad.  I feel so embarrassed for choosing this place.  A few highlights of the night included: -Waiting 15 min to meet a waiter, then took 3 tries to actually bring the wine we ordered -Every table around us was brought bread.. except for ours -An owner who was comfortable ordering staff around in front of us but never actually seemed to help -An exhorbitantly long wait for our meal -Waiter offered to bring parmesan for the table.. but never came back.  Not for the parm, not to check in, not even to bring the check! -Finally went to ask for a check, still took another 15 min to get it  There are a million other restaurants in the area.  Do yourself a favor and choose any other one.
Well prepared food.
The stand up comedy on saturday night was great! Very comfortable intimate setting although a little crunched in tight with others
They should offer salad or bread to you when waiting on your meals and drinks!..
The pizza was fake and very bad
So so

The meal was amazing.  Loved the penne all'arrabiatta the spicy marinara had just enough kick without over powering the dish.  I added the meatballs which really took the dish over the top, they were homemade and so good! Our waiter, Jaime, was a treat as well.  Great dinner!
The pasta is good, but the waiter was rude
Outstanding lasagna!

The mussels were marvelous... The waiter's attitude when I said I was passing time till the comedy show was LESS THAN MARVELOUS!! I just had a cappuccino and an antipasti of the mussels, he gave me a side dish of disdain... Sorry, I opted to have dinner with my son who was in a show downtown and didn't have time to drive all the way to Bethesda!
Excellent service!

The food here was good. However, the staff was horrible! I had to flag management down to refill my drink after waiting with an empty glass for over 15 minutes. I also has to flag the waiter down to get the check. I expect better than this from a restaurant that has been in business since 1977...
Fun and accommodating event space!
Always excellent food and great service.
Group dinner very nicely done at a fixed price. Delicious Rockish ... Well seasoned and properly cooked. Bravo.
Nice venue. Staff is wonderful.   Food is average.
Very helpful. Very good food.
Food was good service fast
The food is amazing

I went here for my little brother’s birthday party and had a magnificent dinner with good friends. The atmosphere was identical to those of restaurants I visited in Italy this past summer. The service was excellent and the menu was a array of food that could satisfy any hunger while hitting your taste buds with the most pleasant of flavors. I recommend it to anyone who’s going for a party, date, or business meeting. This place will get your dinner right. Grazie!
Amazing.
It looks beautiful inside, but for an event they need to get a bigger bar.
Good italian food
Great atmosphere and food
Went there for a party, and I personally am not a fan of pasta, but it was amazing, so were the Shirley Temples.
Unfortunately the company event we had there did not have great service or food.  The restaurant may be better for non-company events.
Charming atmosphere, very attentive wait staff
Extremely inattentive service. Mediocre food.
we go every year for work Christmas party the staff is excellent the food is excellent beautiful
I didn't have dinner.  I attended the comedy club. The atmosphere was friendly.  Looking forward to trying the cuisine.
Attended a rehearsal dinner in a great space. +plus I'm an eggplant parm fan and theirs was great. -minus There is no excuse for a ladies with no TP.
Good food fresh and delicious

Excellent value for your dollar. This place is a land mark in Bethesda. It has reliability good food at an excellent price. I live nearby and have been back a few times. The past was excellent and the meat was a good portion. The calamari was good, and the vegetables were good as well. Nothing was bad, but it didn't blow my socks off either. Very good service and quick seating and excellent value. I'll be back.

Was here on Tuesday night with a group of 7 people. We all enjoyed our main courses & wine. Rather big portion, which is not a problem for me personally 😁 it's only that we then couldn't finish our desserts. I love the ambience, the friendly staff, not-long wait & of course the food.
Had my wedding rehearsal dinner here, great food and staff!
very nice place great food great service!!
It's really Italian cuisine!...great ambience, careful attention to all dining service.  Fully recommend

What a thoroughly enjoyable meal.  We started off with a Caesar salad, with fresh dressing made in house.  The salad was way better than the production dressings you normally get.   My salmon was both seasoned and cooked to perfection, crisp on the outside and moist on the inside.  The accompanying vegetables were fresh, and cooked as they should have been.   For desert, the chocolate  cake was over the top and the Bavarian creme layering and topping was light and flavorable as compared to the usual very rich and heavy chocolate cake.

Was there on a Sunday evening with one waiter handling a full room. Food and service took way too long, and as professional as the waiter was, management should have had additional staff. Otherwise,  the food itself was exquisite.
Nice servers
Says it opens at 12:00 am. Wasted gas to come at 3:40. Was closed and we had to call them to find out it opens at 5:30 !
Nice decorating, but the food does not inspire. If you’re spending money to go out, try something else.
A fair Italian restaurant.  Not sure we'll visit again anytime soon. Pricey, too.
The decor is very well done here. The food is also good. We ate a late dinner and our waiter disappeared. One of our deserts never came out.(We weren't charged.)
Great food, great service, great atmosphere.

Our retirement party at Positano's was a huge success!  The servers were so very kind and sweet, the "Old Positano" room was the ideal size for a party of 50, there was a perfect set-up for a DJ, and everyone loved the appetizers and food.  This is our 3rd party at Positano's.  Thank you Jimmy and your staff for helping us create a memorable event.
Been here a couple times. Intimate indoor dining space with great food. Their red sauce has so much flavor. Great service.
Great food. Easy parking. Very nice staff

Great place to come to. Beautiful atmosphere.  Friendly staff. Had spaghetti and meatball, fettuccine Alfredo. Home made mozzarella cheese with tomato n oil.   Dessert. Home made lemon tart cream cake. Very good. Also crime brûlée. Great. Gonna come back for sure even tho there are many good Italian restaurants within walking distance!
Delicious food. Great atmosphere. Convenient parking.
Good stuffed mushrooms
Plain taste

We have been going to Positano, with friends and family, for almost 3 decades. Have known the owners and the longtime staff for just as long. When we worked in downtown Bethesda, this was our favorite spot for Office farewells and Christmas parties. We have taken several of our overseas guests there for dinner. The food is always delicious, and service warm and courteous. The outdoor sitting in the late Spring and Summer is charming. I wholeheartedly recommend this place for a quick lunch or lingering dinner
Great atmosphere and authentic cuisine!
Absolutely amazing spaghetti and meatballs, wasn't too busy on the weekday evening when we went. Great service.

I was surprised by how much seating is available; it's larger than it looks from the street!  We were part of a special event and had reserved one of the rooms.  The staff was very kind and helpful and patient with our large group!

Amazing ambiance! Loved the romantic, cozy atmosphere in the party room. The singer/musician was wonderful! It is my third time here and can't wait to come back. Last time I came it was with my mother in law who is very knowledgeable of gourmet food... especially authentic Italian, & she enjoyed it. I really wanted to come here to have a romantic dinner to celebrate Valentine's & it was perfect! I find the price reasonable considering the excellent service and warm atmosphere.

The service was fantastic. The servers were friendly and attentive and we were served quickly despite our very large group. The food was good and reasonably priced considering the area. I would definitely eat there again, especially if going with a large party.
Amazing atmosphere,  friendly staff,  and food for a decent price.
They were so accommodating to our Church Group and made for a wonderful Night!!!
Outstanding service, delicious food, great ambiance!   We’re definitely coming back soon!!!

You have to use street or garage parking [at least a couple of blocks away]. I don't mind the cost so much, but Positano lacks valet parking. For an downtown restaurant, that's too inconvenient for older or wheelchair clientele. That's unfortunate I remember the food as being very good.

Cute place but the food is overpriced for what you get. A few scallops on some noodles with some oil and  not very flavorful sauce is almost $20 no salad no nothing. They were pretty busy and the service was all screwed up. For example one person at the table had finished their dinner before another person's meal even arrived. We ordered drinks several times and they never came and they never checked in our table we had to go hunt the waiter down everytime we needed something. We would definitely not eat there again unless a good band was playing.
Filet mignon was good, but beers were like 8 bucks.
Pretty good Italian food.  Service was attentive.
Beautiful restaurant
If you are looking for authentic Italian this is the place to go.
Quaint place with typical food. Appeals more to an older, more traditional demographic.
Family owned authentic Italian fare in a cozy setting. Best eggplant, pasta a ten. Get the mussels

The appetizers were fine. The main dish not...the pasta was over cooked and the salsa flavorless.( sea food spaghetti) Drinks good and the staff very nice in general, with the exception of our waiter... it seems bother every time we ask for something. The restaurant ambiance is like going back to a old town in italy... nice. The space is huge.

Excellent restaurant with oodles of cozy Italian ambiance. The food was delicious and the wine superb. The service was charming yet discreet. There are parking garages close by, but note that the one right across the street closes at 8PM. We will definitely be back for more delish dinners.

Great original Bethesda Italian restaurant. Good prices and authentic food. If you're looking for a real Italian restaurant experience and not some overpriced imitation this is the place. Staff is friendly and the ambiance is truly original.
Great restaurant with delicious Italuan cuisine!
Amazing service and atmosphere, felt just like we were in Italy. Great prices and the food was delicious.
Great Italian restaurant. Feels very authentic. Food and service were great!

Decent Italian decor.  Friendly staff.  Food (shrimp marinara pasta, chicken platter and filet mignon plate) was tasty and properly done.  Acoustics were terrible - two hundred people reminiscing at a 50th HS reunion make a lot of noise - you had to strain to hear the person next to you.  Service was haphazard,  though friendly.  Pasta served first, then chicken, then steak.  The process took twenty minutes or so.  By the time we were all served and could begin eating (one of our party actually went and picked up the final steak), we were all eating luke warm dinners.
Excellent
Great staff
Traditional Italian dishes, Elegantly served
Delicious pasta that has been consistent for last ten years
The place is really romantic with live music from Timul. He made my date special. The food is ok, I have had better Italian food in the past. The staff should be more friendly.
I cannot say enough about this amazing restaurant. The food, staff,  and atmosphere are perfection!
(Translated by Google) Excellent Italian food  (Original) Exelente comida italiana
Old world Italian food. Beautiful restaurant. Yummy tomato sauce.
Great place for our NBC reunion lunch. Food was delicious, very impressed with the speed and quality of food provided for 50 people.
Very nice and quaint restaurant with in house traditional Italian music. Great food, kind service and a romantic setting.

Great Italian food if you get the right dish.  Their homemade pasta is incredible.  The garlic bread was alright, and their wine selection was pretty good.  The atmosphere is very relaxed, and there's a guy that plays guitar softly to add to the mood.
Just a great spot. Classic Italian.
Great Italian food
I could eat here everyday. Feels like you're dining in Italy. I love it.
Super cool atmosphere, but the food wasn't anything special.
Loved the atmosphere but I will give the food another try...
Food was blame, service good
Very beautiful interior!

In planning an 80th birthday party for my husband recently, I checked countless places for price, size of room, menu offered, etc.  Thankfully, I booked the party at Positano's and it was perfect!  Jimmy, the owner and banquet manager, was incredibly cooperative from day one. They have a number of different size rooms and Jimmy helped me decide which was best to accommodate the size of our party plus a DJ and dancing room.  I picked a menu for a VERY reasonable price that included choices of three appetizers, three entrees, and desserts.  Along the way, because many of the guests were seniors, I had to make repeated changes in the menu as well as the number of attendees and Jimmy was gracious and pleasant throughout.  I was able to bring in a few things (veggie platter, fruit platter, cake) to accommodate all the dietary quirks among the guests and there was no problem. At the party, the passed hors d'oeuvres were plentiful and delicious, the entrees were perfectly cooked and hot (I'm not sure how you prepare 30+ servings of moist salmon, but they did it!), and the servers were gracious and responsive.  Two children asked for spaghetti and sauce, which were not the selected entrees, but they were brought in two minutes with no question.  Positano's and Jimmy were a pleasure in every way!!

Fantastic meal, fantastic staff! Best Italian dinner since I was stationed in Sardinia back in 1993! If you are looking for authentic Italian...Positano is the very best! From appetizers to cappuccino and desert...every plate is a masterpiece...thank you!

I always have a wonderful experience at Positanos! The owner, management, and waitstaff are all very accommodating and professional. Best bruschetta I've ever had! Highly recommend the veal chop. It includes vegetables, eggplant parmesan, pasta etc. Always delicious! All of their desserts are fabulous! Beautiful outside patio! One of my favorite restaurants! Highly recommend always!!
The party facility is a great space. Always a good time with great food

One of the last of a dying breed of great, family-owned restaurants in Bethesda. It's a shame that Bethesda is steadily moving toward the faceless, bland high-end chain restaurants, but such is progress, I suppose. This restaurant is one of the best in Bethesda, if not the best.

The first time I visited this establishment a year ago, the food was fabulous and very flavorful.  The second time I visited recently, it seemed as though there was a new chef as I ordered the same dish as last time and this time around it was lacking flavor and was too cheesy.
Overcooked fish, uninspired side dishes

We were dressed nice casual when we went here on October 3rd 2015. It was rainy, and a bit cold outside. We had never been to Bethesda or this restaurant before. We went there based on the Google reviews I read. When we came through the second door a person immediately walked up very close to us and had a posture as if he was going to greet us and ask how many of us were there but instead he postured and looked at us and said nothing in that akward moment and his expression to me was to say what are you doing here this is not the restaurant for you. We should have left then. I ended up saying two, and he quickly seated us at the first seat on the wall closest to the door and left us with menus, and a beer list. He quickly left. So, first off the decor in my opinion is tacky and overdone. Look at the Google reviews pictures, look at the floor to the left in the entryway. That's an indicator of the rest of what I was able to see. There are endless amounts of 'decorations' everywhere including an antiquish streetcar for some reason; to me it seemed to just have stuff placed on it, not sure what but it wasn't interesting. Our table which you can see in the pictures is like I said the first one by the door and its next to a wall of used wine bottles on a rack. The light above the table was a pendant that was off center of the table, too low, and too bright for its position. On the table is a little corked bottle of what seemed to be olive oil. We ended up being sort of greeted by a waitress who I think was trying to do a good job but clearly was being expected to handle way too much for what I could later tell was poor management. The waitress had other people that worked with her and I would say they were from the same background which was a different one from which management is and I again got a feeling her and her coworkers were a package deal and they were doing all that they could considering the workload. I looked at the menu, it was one of those menus that has the leather like material sewn around the edges and the menu is inside vinyl pockets. The menu clearly had been used for the last 5-25 years, it was scratched, sticky, dirty, and not user friendly. Theres some tacky story about the restaurant and how such and such will be great at taking over the business when they ride oft into the sunset. A small warm loaf of sliced Italian bread arrived without butter but I figured that's why we for small plates to pour the olive oil onto and dip the bread. Let me tell you this was either bad oil or because it was not infused with seasonings as is common, it was not at all good. The bread was fine plain. Our order was taken without issue but also without anything really. The water glasses bad been filled at this point but I had already noticed they were heavily scratched, dingy looking, and probably dirty also; again they had probably been in use since 1492. The diet coke we ordered arrived in a promotional beer glass with the name of a beer on on, I think it was Hoodengarden or something like that. The glass even had a 30ml marker on it which I think indicate if you put ice to that level then the liquid would be about 30ml. The fact that it was served in these classes meant nothing bad to me, I just mention it because if the person who seated us acted the way he did for the reasons I felt he had then these glasses said nothing for the level of fancy he may think the restaurant is supposed to exude. Nothing on the menu seemed like a great option but we both decided how can you screw up spaghetti and meatballs. While we waited a long time for that to arrive the famy next to us which was two parents and two young teens. Their group was dressed the same as us and they were respectful. When their food arrived there was an issue with one kids food. He waited the entire time the others were eating before he received his meal. This review won't allow much more so let me say the food was low grade, management lurked right next to us, service was slow, we would not return.

I am Italian and I can say with credibility that this restaurant is as authentic and delicious as it gets when looking at Italian restaurants in the states. Having been to Italy five times, the food at Positano Ristorante tastes just like the food I had while visiting Naples, Rome, Venice, and Sicily, which is absolutely amazing. The food is made to perfection with an amazing surrounding ambiance to complement the meal. Over 35 years, Positano has been serving amazing Italian food and has the best Lasagna in town, a very popular Italian pasta dish. Do not be decieved by American "Italian" food like Maggiano's and Olive Garden, eat real delicious Italian food at Positano where everything is made with passion and delivered with elegance.
A real family Italian restaurant - dishes can be uneven but generally very good - great place for families early and couples later
This is the best Italian Restaurant I've ever been to their Fettuccini Alfredo is by far the best me and my wife has ever had!!!! 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

This was a great place to go for a perfect meal for a perfect night. The service was excellent and the food even better! We had Brochette for an appetizer that was delicious.  The Lasagna for dinner was the best I have ever had. The pasta was hand made and and light and the sauce was perfectly seasoned. My date had Salmon that was fresh and tender. The desserts the tiramisu and rum cake were to live for!  I have traveled the world and this place was top notch. Who knew Bethesda was hiding this little gem.

What a great place! excellent home made and delicious italy food!!  love the italian decor and will definitely return for more!!  if you want good italian food and you are anywhere near bethesda - you must go here!
